metadata.feature_description: Retrieve and manage URL management options including locales, status codes, and site aliases

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Languages tab
steps.expected: Languages tab should display all available locales for the site
steps.actual: Languages tab displayed showing two enabled locales: English (United States) and Español (España, Alfabetización Internacional)

steps.action: Verify locale configuration in Site Aliases
steps.expected: Site aliases should reflect the available locales
steps.actual: Site aliases show locale-specific URLs: localhost:8081/en-us (en-US) and localhost:8081/es-es (es-ES)

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages > select a page > Advanced > S.E.O. tab and click Add URL
steps.expected: URL Type dropdown should display available status codes
steps.actual: Add URL form displayed with URL Type dropdown showing two status codes: Active (200) and Redirect (301)

steps.action: Open the URL Type dropdown to view all options
steps.expected: Dropdown should list Active (200) and Redirect (301) status codes
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing Active (200) highlighted as current selection and Redirect (301) as second option

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Retrieve site aliases and primary alias

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages > select Home page > Advanced > S.E.O. tab and click Add URL
steps.expected: Site Alias dropdown should display available site aliases
steps.actual: Add URL form displayed with Site Alias dropdown showing localhost:8081/en-us as default selection

steps.action: Open the Site Alias dropdown to view all aliases
steps.expected: Dropdown should list all configured site aliases
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing three aliases: localhost:8081 (base), localhost:8081/en-us (English), localhost:8081/es-es (Spanish)

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Site Behavior > Site Aliases to verify primary alias
steps.expected: Site Aliases tab should show all aliases with PRIMARY indicator
steps.actual: Site Aliases tab displayed showing all three aliases with PRIMARY checkmarks in the PRIMARY column

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Site Behavior > Site Aliases
steps.expected: URL Mapping section should display site alias usage configuration options
steps.actual: URL Mapping section displayed with Site Alias Mapping Mode options: Canonical, Redirect, None. Auto Add Site Alias toggle also available.

steps.action: Navigate to Site Settings > Languages tab and verify locale settings
steps.expected: Languages should be correctly configured with System Default and Site Default
steps.actual: Languages tab shows System Default as English (United States), Site Default dropdown set to English (United States). Enable Language Parameter in URLs is On, Enable Browser Language Detection is On.

observations: The GetUrlOptions() API is called when accessing page-specific URL settings (Content > Pages > [page] > Advanced > S.E.O. > Add URL)
The site has a multi-locale setup with English (United States) and Spanish (Spain) enabled
Three site aliases are configured: base (localhost:8081), English (localhost:8081/en-us), and Spanish (localhost:8081/es-es)
Status codes available are Active (200) for live URLs and Redirect (301) for redirected URLs
Site Alias Mapping Mode is set to Canonical by default
The Locales dropdown may not appear in the Add URL form when site aliases already include language-specific URLs (language is implicit in the site alias selection)
